abstract.p: Internet Policy Institute, Washington-based independent research organization, plans to hold eight 'town hall' meetings to gather grass-roots information on Internet policies and will present its findings to next president after November elections; photo (S)

block.p: The Internet Policy Institute, a Washington-based independent research organization, plans to hold eight ''town hall'' meetings to gather grass-roots information on Internet policies and will present its findings to the next president after the November elections. The meetings are being held jointly with eight universities across the country to get ''outside the Beltway'' views on the Internet, said James L. Barksdale, former president and chief executive of Netscape Communications and chairman of the institute, which is nonpartisan.

The Internet Policy Institute, a Washington-based independent research organization, plans to hold eight ''town hall'' meetings to gather grass-roots information on Internet policies and will present its findings to the next president after the November elections. The meetings are being held jointly with eight universities across the country to get ''outside the Beltway'' views on the Internet, said James L. Barksdale, former president and chief executive of Netscape Communications and chairman of the institute, which is nonpartisan.
